page.title: 08 Knightswood Farm
page.content:
Knightswood Farm is in North Baddesley. It measures 180 acres and is a dairy farm. The milk is sent for cheese manufacture. They have 132 cows, 21 pigs, 2 geese and 110 young stock. There are no dogs on the farm. The farmer uses a machine to check on the cows health.
The farmer has lived there since 1957. He employs 3 men. The farm has not changed in 10 years but the milking equipment has. They use 4 tractors and trailers and have 1 working car.
They mainly shop at Carrefour and Safeway. They attend St.Boniface Church regularly.
